item.title: CCPD & Unity House of Troy Info Session | Sept. 30
item.description: The CCPD will be hosting an info session with Unity House of Troy on Tuesday, September 30th! If you’re interested in helping those in need and seeing the resilience of a community in action, Unity House offer opportunities in the form of employment, volunteer roles, and internships. Come learn more about available opportunities and the valuable work that Unity House does for the community! Registration and details are available in Handshake.

item.description: Date: Wednesday, October 1, 2025 6:00 PM - 7:30 PM - Learn the basics of correct thesis organization and format, appropriate paper attribution and reference citation styles—plus a review of the most commonly found mistakes and ways to avoid them. item.title: Mercer XLab Fall 2025 Schedule and Information Directory
item.description: The Mercer XLab is NOW open 8 a.m. - 8 p.m. on weekdays during the Fall 2025 semester. All RPI students are welcome to learn from our Mercer X Student Workers! They can help you design your project, print your first PCB, learn how to solder, borrow electronic parts and instrumentation, and more. Come try Analog Devices Inc.’s new devices intended for “AI on the edge,” where small microcontrollers run your AI for image recognition and speech detection. We’ll see you soon on the JEC 6th floor!

item.description: Multimedia Services would like to inform the campus about an issue affecting CATV services in several buildings: Sage, Troy, Ricketts, and 87Gym. Our service provider has identified the issue–an underground cable–and will implement repairs as soon as possible. We apologize for any inconvenience this may cause and appreciate patience as we work toward a resolution. New information will be provided as soon as it becomes available. Thank you for your understanding.

item.title: Did you know that a quarter of staff vacancies are filled by current employees?
item.description: Did you know that nearly 1 in 4 of the posted staff vacancies at RPI are filled by current RPI employees? Ever wonder if you could be next? Competing for a vacancy is an effective way to learn more about other jobs on campus and has the added benefit of giving hiring managers the chance to learn more about your career aspirations, your talents, and your contributions. To see what’s available and/or to apply for a job – go to https://careers.rpi.edu or email careers@rpi.edu

item.title: Faculty & Staff - We Need Your Feedback
item.description: As part of our campus master planning process, we invite you to complete a campus-wide survey to help shape a future that meets the needs of the RPI community. The survey is designed to capture how faculty and staff use the Troy campus today and how spaces can better support learning, research, and campus life in the future.
